result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert N Niber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work and treatment.
Sign up for probation no later than 11/4/22.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and compliance with treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

Submit a DNA sample by 11/4/22 and pay the surcharge during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert N Niber

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert N Niber in court.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Robert N Niber.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 1 day time served, Huber Privileges for work and treatment. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 6 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 11/04/22.
- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. 
- Complete 15 hours of community service.
- Obtain/maintain full time school/work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample by 11/04/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Defendant Robert N Niber in court.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Robert N Niber.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Matter set for deferred prosecution agreement.  Defendant has a TAD evaluation scheduled for later this date and Atty. Rebholz requests an adjournment of this hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert N Niber
Current: PO Box 26800, Milwaukee, WI 53226 United States  (Effective: 08-16-2022)
Prior: W349N5225 Point Comfort Drive, Okauchee, WI 53069

Defendant Robert N Niber in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Calendar Call. Defendant appears. Court vacates the stayed warrant. Case adjourned for  Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing, Branch 01.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No appearance made by defendant. Hearing held via zoom. Status conference held. Attorney Rebholz stated that defendant has completed TAD evaluation. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 01.  Calendar call scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Robert N Niber in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  
Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Defendant has a TAD evaluation scheduled and Atty. Rebholz requests date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robert N Niber in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  
Brandon Schwebler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Rebholz has received discovery and an offer and requests time to review it with his client.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Robert N Niber in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 1 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/13/2022@2:30pm
